page.title: 12SHOPPING CHANGES IN WITHAM.
page.content: In the late 1930's F.W. Woolworth's store was opened, making a big difference to local shopping. It was known as the"3d and 6d" nothing sold cost more than 6d (2pence now!). The population was about 6,000.There used to be tradesmen who went from door to door,such as the Milkman who filled your jug from the churn on the cart. Greengrocery vendors and fish & chip men also had carts. The icecream man came on a bicycle. Some of the small shops were Hannah (grocer),Rose (greengrocer), Breatrex, and Hines ,(grocers/ confectioners), Doole's (grocer and sub post office). Newland Street had larger shops,Home & Colonial, International, (grocers), Luckin Smiths (ironmongers), and the largest, The Co-op.There were two high class shops Hedley Cook (pork butcher) , & Maison Carton (pastry cook).
